title.narrative: Increase Resilience and Livelihood Diversification of Rural Women Communities through creative Industries Value Chain Development

description.narrative: The project proposal originated from the interest of NORAD in funding a project similar to the currently existing UNIDO-UNDP Project in Creative Industries in Madagascar. This project will build upon on the success of the UNDP-UNIDO crafts development project in southern Madagascar which initiated the process of developing a new line of furniture and decorative items but that ended at the prototyping phase. To achieve sustainability and attain a multiplier effect, this project includes both an institutional and a practical component. On one side, institutions will be strengthened in order to develop sustainable services to address the needs of most vulnerable people and women as well as SME in the creative industries sector on creation and production techniques as well as on entrepreneurship, management and marketing. On the other side, women will be empowered by the provision of technical skill and production tools along the rural value chain. Following the tested methodology, three new production lines will be launched. The project also includes the activities under UNIDO's responsibility as part of the joint UN Programme on #Renforcement des moyens de subsistance pour la Résilience Communautaire# coordinated by UNDP. UNDP will fund 1,034 million USD -both are part of the UNDAF 2015-2019. The project also
